page.title: 14Ollerton Village - Social
page.content: The character of the village has changed since coal was discovered at New Ollerton and,indeed,it continues to do so.New housing has added greatly to the size of the village, much of this being occupied by retired people and those in "professional" employment at,for example,the Dukeries Complex. A focal point of social life is the{Ollerton Village Jubilee Hall.}It was first proposed in 1977 after money was raised for the Queen's Jubilee. It was decided that the{community spirit this produced should be fostered, and the resultant Â£20,000 raised over the next 5 years shows how successful this has been. This money, together with Â£60,000 in grants, was used to build the Hall, which was opened in 1983. Fund-raising still continues as it is felt there is an{urgent need}for a children's play area.
